net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao

Class EntityRetriever

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao.EntityRetriever
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EntityRetrieverImpl

    public abstract class EntityRetriever
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A singleton access point for retrieving attached entities.
    Author:
    Kevin Beaty (kbeaty@i2rd.com)
    See Also:

        public static EntityRetriever getInstance()
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets an instance from the SpringBeanRetriever.
        Returns:
        the instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a EntityRetriever implementation is not registered in spring with name "hibernate-utils-entity-retriever"

      • loadEntity

public abstract <E> E loadEntity(java.lang.Class<E> entityClass,
                                             java.io.Serializable id)
        Deprecated. 
        Load an entity by id.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the entity type
        Parameters:
        entityClass - the type of entity to load
        id - the database id for the entity to load
        Returns:
        the entity, or null if the specified entity doesn't exist.

      • narrowProxyIfPossible

        public abstract <E> E narrowProxyIfPossible(@Nullable
                                            java.lang.Object entity)
                                     throws java.lang.ClassCastException
        Narrows a possibly proxied entity to the most specific entity type possible. This will allow instanceof to work correctly for cases when an entity is proxied for a base class. Since the method may return a different instance, an identity check (==) may fail for the returned instance if compared against the specified entity.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the expected entity return type.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to narrow if possible
        Returns:
        the possibly narrowed entity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the entity cannot be narrowed to the proxied class, or if return type is not instanceof E

      • reattachIfNecessary

        @Contract(value="null->null;!null->!null")
public abstract <E> E reattachIfNecessary(@Nullable
                                                                                     E entity)
        Reattaches the entity if it is in a detached state. If the entity is in a persistent or transient state, or if null, it is returned. If the parameter is not a hibernate entity, it will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the entity type
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to reattach if necessary
        Returns:
        an entity, equal (possibly equivalent) to the parameter, reattached if possible.
